foreignData.name: Messingstadt
foreignData.text:
Immer wenn die Messingstadt getappt wird, fügt sie Dir 1 Schadenspunkt zu.
{T}: Erhöhe Deinen Manavorrat um ein Mana einer beliebigen Farbe.

mainBoard.name: City of Brass
mainBoard.originalText:
Whenever City of Brass becomes tapped, it deals 1 damage to you.
ocT: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

rulings.text: The first ability triggers no matter how the land becomes tapped.

If you tap City of Brass while you are casting a spell or activating an ability, its ability will trigger and wait. When you finish casting that spell or activating that ability, City of Brass’s triggered ability is put on the stack on top of it. City of Brass’s ability will resolve first.

On the other hand, you can tap City of Brass, put its triggered ability on the stack, and then respond to that ability by casting an instant or activating an ability using that mana. In that case, the instant spell or activated ability will resolve first.

mainBoard.text:
Whenever City of Brass becomes tapped, it deals 1 damage to you.
{T}: Add one mana of any color.

foreignData.name: Edelsteinmine
foreignData.text:
Lege drei Minenmarken auf die Edelsteinmine, wenn sie ins Spiel kommt.
{T}, entferne eine Minenmarke von der Edelsteinmine: Erhöhe Deinen Manavorrat um ein Mana einer beliebigen Farbe. Begrabe die Edelsteinmine, wenn keine Minenmarken auf ihr liegen.

mainBoard.name: Gemstone Mine
mainBoard.originalText:
When Gemstone Mine comes into play, put three mining counters on it.
ocT, Remove a mining counter from Gemstone Mine: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool. If there are no mining counters on Gemstone Mine, bury it.

rulings.text: Sacrificing this card when the last counter is removed is part of the effect of tapping it for mana.

If the last mining counter is removed from Gemstone Mine in some way other than activating its ability (such as Chisei, Heart of Oceans), Gemstone Mine won’t be sacrificed but its ability can’t be activated.

mainBoard.text:
Gemstone Mine enters the battlefield with three mining counters on it.
{T}, Remove a mining counter from Gemstone Mine: Add one mana of any color. If there are no mining counters on Gemstone Mine, sacrifice it.

foreignData.text: {T}: Erhöhe Deinen Manavorrat um ein Mana einer beliebigen Farbe. Bringe das Unentdeckte Paradies zu Beginn Deiner nächsten Enttap-Phase auf die Hand seines Besitzers zurück.

mainBoard.name: Undiscovered Paradise
mainBoard.originalText: ocT: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool. At the beginning of your next untap phase, return Undiscovered Paradise to owner's hand.

rulings.text: It will return even if some effect prevents you from untapping it. The ability is not replacing the untapping of the land in any way.
Only returns to owner’s hand if it is still on the battlefield at the beginning of its controller’s next untap.

mainBoard.text: {T}: Add one mana of any color. During your next untap step, as you untap your permanents, return Undiscovered Paradise to its owner's hand.

mainBoard.flavorText: "The true dishonor for a soldier is surviving the war." —Telim'Tor

foreignData.name: Erfahrener Fußsoldat
foreignData.text: {T}: Eine angreifende Zielkreatur erhält +1/+1 bis zum Ende des Zuges.

mainBoard.name: Infantry Veteran
mainBoard.originalText: ocT: Target attacking creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

rulings.text: An “attacking creature” is one that has been declared as an attacker this combat, or one that was put onto the battlefield attacking this combat. Unless that creature leaves combat, it continues to be an attacking creature through the end of combat step, even if the player it was attacking has left the game, or the planeswalker it was attacking has left combat.

mainBoard.text: {T}: Target attacking creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

mainBoard.flavorText: A shield of light admits no shadow.

mainBoard.name: Welkin Hawk
mainBoard.originalText:
Flying
If Welkin Hawk is put into any graveyard from play, you may search your library for a Welkin Hawk card, reveal that card to all players, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your library afterwards.

rulings.text: You do not have to find a Welkin Hawk card if you do not want to.

mainBoard.text:
Flying
When Welkin Hawk dies, you may search your library for a card named Welkin Hawk, reveal that card, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

mainBoard.flavorText: Out of the blackness and stench of the engulfing swamp emerged a shimmering figure. Only the splattered armor and ichor-stained sword hinted at the unfathomable evil the knight had just laid waste.

rulings.text: This is not modal. If the target changes from an artifact to an enchantment or vice versa, this still destroys it.

mainBoard.flavorText: "Yes, I think 'toast' is an appropriate description." —Jaya Ballard, task mage

foreignData.name: Einäscherung
foreignData.text: Die Einäscherung fügt einem Spieler oder einer Kreatur Deiner Wahl 3 Schadenspunkte zu. Kreaturen, denen die Einäscherung in diesem Zug Schaden zugefügt hat, können nicht regenerieren.

mainBoard.name: Incinerate
mainBoard.originalText: Incinerate deals 3 damage to target creature or player. Creatures damaged by Incinerate cannot regenerate this turn.

rulings.text: Regeneration abilities that would affect that creature can still be activated; they just won’t do anything. The creature can’t be regenerated for any reason, even if an effect other than Incinerate would deal lethal damage to it or otherwise destroy it.

mainBoard.text: Incinerate deals 3 damage to any target. A creature dealt damage this way can't be regenerated this turn.

mainBoard.flavorText: Hope of deliverance is scorched by the fire of futility.

foreignData.name: Anfachen
foreignData.text: Das Anfachen fügt einer Kreatur oder einem Spieler Schadenspunkte in Höhe von 2 plus der Anzahl an Anfachen-Karten in allen Friedhöfen zu.

mainBoard.name: Kindle
mainBoard.originalText: Kindle deals to target creature or player an amount of damage equal to 2 plus the number of Kindle cards in all graveyards.

rulings.text: Because Kindle is still on the stack as you perform its instructions, it isn’t in your graveyard and won’t add to the amount of damage dealt.

mainBoard.text: Kindle deals X damage to any target, where X is 2 plus the number of cards named Kindle in all graveyards.

mainBoard.flavorText: Lightning tethers souls to the world. —Kor saying

foreignData.name: Schock
foreignData.text: Schock fügt einer Kreatur oder einem Spieler Deiner Wahl 2 Schadenspunkte zu.

mainBoard.name: Shock
mainBoard.originalText: Shock deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
mainBoard.text: Shock deals 2 damage to any target.

foreignData.name: Zehnteil
foreignData.text: Durchsuche Deine Bibliothek nach einer Ebenenkarte. Wenn Du weniger Länder als ein Gegner Deiner Wahl kontrollierst, kannst Du Deine Bibliothek nach einer zusätzlichen Ebenenkarte durchsuchen. Zeige diese Karten allen Spielern und nimm sie auf. Mische Deine Bibliothek danach neu.

mainBoard.name: Tithe
mainBoard.originalText: Search your library for a plains card. If you control fewer lands than target opponent, you may search your library for an additional plains card. Reveal those cards to all players and put them into your hand. Shuffle your library afterwards.

rulings.text: Counts lands on resolution, not on announcement.
Because the “search” requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don’t have to find the card if you don’t want to.

mainBoard.text: Search your library for a Plains card. If target opponent controls more lands than you, you may search your library for an additional Plains card. Reveal those cards and put them into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

foreignData.name: Götterdämmerung
foreignData.text: Zerstöre alle Länder.

Artefaktsprüche und Verzauberungssprüche kosten für einen Gegner Deiner Wahl zusätzlich 2
Opfere die Aura des Schweigens: Zerstöre ein Artefakt oder eine Verzauberung Deiner Wahl.

sideBoard.name: Aura of Silence
sideBoard.originalText:
Artifact and enchantment spells cost target opponent an additional o2 to play.
Sacrifice Aura of Silence: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

rulings.text: Aura of Silence affects all opponents in a multiplayer game.

sideBoard.text:
Artifact and enchantment spells your opponents cast cost {2} more to cast.
Sacrifice Aura of Silence: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

foreignData.name: Schutzkreis gegen Rot
foreignData.text: {1}:Verhindere allen Schaden, der Dir aus einer roten Quelle zugefügt wird. (Weiterer Schaden aus dieser Quelle wird normal behandelt)

sideBoard.name: Circle of Protection: Red
sideBoard.originalText: o1: Prevent all damage to you from a red source. (Treat further damage from that source normally.)

rulings.text: A source of damage is a permanent, a spell on the stack (including one that creates a permanent), or any object referred to by an object on the stack. A source doesn’t need to be capable of dealing damage to be a legal choice.
Can be used even when there is no damage to prevent. It prevents the next damage (if any) from the source this turn.

sideBoard.text: {1}: The next time a red source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

sideBoard.flavorText: "My horizon was the arcing petals, my new home resplendent with spires of weeds and pillows of fragrant pollen." —Naimah, Femeref philosopher

foreignData.name: Stadt der Einsamkeit
foreignData.text: Jeder Spieler kann Zaubersprüche und Fähigkeiten nur während seines Zuges sprechen bzw. benutzen.

sideBoard.name: City of Solitude
sideBoard.originalText: Each player may play spells and abilities only during his or her turn.

rulings.text: City of Solitude can affect abilities of cards that are not on the battlefield because it prevents players from activating those abilities.
City of Solitude does not stop triggered abilities from being put on the stack. They are never “activated”.
This stops players from activating mana abilities.

sideBoard.text: Players can cast spells and activate abilities only during their own turns.

foreignData.name: Kreuzzug
foreignData.text: Alle weißen Kreaturen erhalten +1/+1.

sideBoard.flavorText: The swarm seemed unmoved by the artificial slivers' destruction. "They clearly were not the leaders," Hanna cursed. "I guess we'll have to do this the hard way."

foreignData.name: Entzauberung
foreignData.text: Zerstöre ein Artefakt oder eine Verzauberung Deiner Wahl.

sideBoard.name: Disenchant

rulings.text: This is not modal. If the target changes from an artifact to an enchantment or vice versa, this still destroys it.

foreignData.name: Zoll
foreignData.text: Jeder Spieler bestimmt eine der Kreaturen mit den höchsten Gesamtspruchkosten, die er kontrolliert, und bezahlt dann Mana in der Höhe der Gesamtspruchkosten dieser Kreatur oder begräbt die Kreatur.

sideBoard.name: Tariff
sideBoard.originalText: Each player chooses a creature with the highest total casting cost he or she controls, then pays an amount of mana equal to that creature's total casting cost or buries the creature.

rulings.text: The choice of creatures is made on resolution and not on announcement.
You can use mana abilities during the resolution of this spell if the player decides to pay the mana cost.
You choose whether to pay or not on resolution. If not, then you sacrifice the creature. You can choose to not pay if you control no creatures on resolution.

First the active player identifies the creature they control with the highest mana cost (and chooses one if there’s a tie) and chooses whether to sacrifice it or pay mana. Then each other player in turn order does the same. All creatures sacrificed this way are sacrificed at the same time.
Although Tariff checks the converted mana cost of the creatures on the battlefield, you need to pay the creature’s actual mana cost (including color) to keep it on the battlefield.

sideBoard.text: Each player sacrifices the creature they control with the highest converted mana cost unless they pay that creature's mana cost. If two or more creatures a player controls are tied for highest cost, that player chooses one.

sideBoard.flavorText: "The land promises nothing and keeps its promise." —Oracle en-Vec

foreignData.name: Einöde
foreignData.text:
{T}: Erhöhe Deinen Manavorrat um ein farbloses Mana.
{T}, opfere die Einöde: Zerstöre ein Nicht-Standardland Deiner Wahl.

sideBoard.name: Wasteland
sideBoard.originalText:
ocT: Add one colorless mana to your mana pool.
ocT, Sacrifice Wasteland: Destroy target nonbasic land.
sideBoard.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{T}, Sacrifice Wasteland: Destroy target nonbasic land.

sideBoard.flavorText: "When once winter has ahold, Not willingly does she withdraw her icy touch, wistfully caressing— The deepened air sleeps its cold." —Aline Corralurn, "Late Thaw"

foreignData.name: Frostbringer
foreignData.text: Spieler können während ihrer Enttap-Phase nicht mehr als ein Land enttappen.

sideBoard.name: Winter Orb
sideBoard.originalText: Players cannot untap more than one land during their untap phases.

rulings.text: All permanents untap during a player’s untap step at once. If Winter Orb is tapped as your untap step begins, your lands will all untap.
You can’t tap Winter Orb just because you want to. Another ability, such as that of Glare of Subdual, must instruct or allow you to do so.

sideBoard.text: As long as Winter Orb is untapped, players can't untap more than one land during their untap steps.

foreignData.name: Zurs bizarre Welt
foreignData.text:
Alle Spieler spielen ab jetzt mit offenen Karten.
Immer wenn ein Spieler eine Karte zieht, kann ein anderer Spieler 2 Lebenspunkte bezahlen, damit dieser Spieler die Karte abwerfen muß.

sideBoard.name: Zur's Weirding
sideBoard.originalText:
Players play with their hands face up.
Whenever any player draws a card, any other player may pay 2 life to force the drawing player to discard that card.

rulings.text: If someone pays the cost, then the card was never drawn or discarded. It just gets put into the graveyard directly from the library.
This is a continuous replacement effect that modifies a draw.
If a spell or ability causes more than one card to be drawn, draw the cards one at a time and deal with this replacement before drawing the next card.

When using Dredge with this, you have two choices. You can immediately replace the draw with Dredge, or you can apply Zur’s Weirding’s replacement. If the latter, you first resolve Zur’s Weirding’s ability, then if you’re going to draw the card, decide whether or not to replace that draw with Dredge.

sideBoard.text:
Players play with their hands revealed.
If a player would draw a card, they reveal it instead. Then any other player may pay 2 life. If a player does, put that card into its owner's graveyard. Otherwise, that player draws a card.
